description: I'd lie if I said this trait was worth a whole point.
You recover from pain faster than normal.  DUMMIED OUT because it wasn't actually functional…
You recover from pain much faster than normal.  DUMMIED OUT because it wasn't actually functional…

You've been taught proper table manners from your early childhood on.  Now you can't even think about eating without a table.  Eating without it frustrates you, but eating like a civilized person gives you a bigger morale bonus.
Reading is for nerds!  Boring books are more boring, and you can't have fun by reading books.
Unimplemented.  To be removed after 0.F. to preserve save compatibility.
You have a hard time remembering things.  Your skills will erode slightly faster than usual, and you can remember less terrain.
Sharp claws are extended from the end of your fingers.

name: Helicopter Pilot
description: Everyone can pilot a helicopter nowadays, you don't need this trait.
Your guts have developed the ability to handle poisonous food.  Mostly.
Your bloodstream has developed antibiotic properties.  Your wounds will never become infected.
It's very unlikely that you will catch ambient diseases like a cold or the flu.
Your body is simply immune to diseases.  You will never catch an ambient disease.
You have an exceptional memory, and find it easy to remember things.  Your skills will erode slightly slower than usual.
You can't bear to stay still for long.  Your morale will suffer unless you constantly explore new territory.
//: Un-obsolete NOMAD2 and NOMAD3 if we ever get a way to ensure that a category mutation can only develop if the character starts with a chargen-only trait, instead of automatically dragging the prereq in when it tries to develop the target mutation.
//2: Reminder for if the above is accomplished: NOMAD2 was BIRD, FISH, and CHIMERA; NOMAD3 was CHIMERA.

description: Spending any amount of time in familiar places makes you miserable.  Must.  Keep.  Moving.
The shadows don't seem as dark now.  Activate to toggle NV-visible areas on or off.
You have great low-light vision now, though that doesn't allow you to perform fine tasks such as crafting and reading in darkness.  Activate to toggle NV-visible areas on or off.
Your optic nerves and brain caught up with your eyes.  Now you can see pretty well at night.  Activate to toggle NV-visible areas on or off.
Your brain has caught up with your eyes.  You can see much better in the dark, but sunlight seems much brighter now.  Activate to toggle NV-visible areas on or off.
Your visual processing has shifted: though you can see better in the dark, you're nearsighted in the light.  Maybe glasses would help.  Activate to toggle NV-visible areas on or off.
This mutation has been obsoleted due to the hidden movement speed penalty being removed.  If you see this on a profession or mutate this trait, this is a bug.
Obsoleted due to becoming default behavior.
